item.title: Getting started with pyqt5
item.description: Hello World Example # This example creates a simple window with a button and a line-edit in a layout. It also shows how to connect a signal to a slot, so that clicking the button adds some text to the line-edit. import sys from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QApplication, QWidget if __name__ == '__main__': app = QApplication(sys.argv) w = QWidget() w.resize(250, 150) w.move(300, 300) w.setWindowTitle('Hello World') w.show() sys.exit(app.exec_()) Analysis app = QtWidgets.QApplication(sys.argv)

item.title: Introduction to Progress Bars
item.description: Progress Bars are an integral part of user experience and helps users get an idea on the time left for a given process that runs on the GUI. This topic will go over the basics of implementing a progress bar in your own application. This topic will touch lightly on QThread and the new signals/slots mechanism. Some basic knowledge of PyQt5 widgets is also expected of readers. When adding examples only use PyQt5 and Python built-ins to demonstrate functionality.
